properties.areaDesc: Sullivan; Clearfield; Northern Lycoming; Northern Centre; Cameron; Northern Clinton; Elk
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 6 at 11:00PM EST until February 7 at 1:00PM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of
2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Snowfall
totals may be greater on the higher elevations north and east of
Williamsport.

* WHERE...Portions of central Pennsylvania.

* WHEN...From 5 AM to 1 PM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions will likely impact the latter part of the morning
commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to freezing rain late
tonight, and then to snow or sleet around dawn and then to
heavy snow in the morning. Snowfall rates as high as one inch
per hour are possible around and shortly after sunrise.
Northwest winds will gust between 20 and 30 mph Friday afternoon
while temperatures fall through the 20s.
properties.instruction:
The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on
driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania
roadways.

Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway
and traffic conditions.

To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook
page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 1 PM EST FRIDAY
